title: Orbiting satellites - L of space probe around star

content.question: A space probe orbits a star in an elliptical orbit, as shown in the figure. The probe is farthest from the planet at Point <math alttext="A " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and closest at Point <math alttext="P " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>. At Point <math alttext="P " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, the probe’s kinetic energy is <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> times greater than its kinetic energy at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="L sub P, to, L sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, where <math alttext="L sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="L sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> are the probe’s angular momenta about the star at points <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, respectively?
